results.title: Room to learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Early Learning Centrer and Joyce Chopra
results.brief_description: Shows an outstanding preschool facility - the Early Learning Center, Connecticut, whose design is based on the Montessori philosophy that the environment of early schooling affects a child’s learning processes over a lifetime.

results.title: Room service
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and William A. Seiter
results.brief_description: The Marx Brothers are penniless Broadway producers, living in a hotel, who are planning a new stage show and are waiting for the finance to come through. As their hotel room becomes packed by members of the cast and the hotel bill escalates, the Marx Brothers devise a number of schemes to avoid eviction by the hotel’s management. Also stars Lucille Ball.
results.creator_credit_for_label: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and William A. Seiter

results.title: Room full of energy
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Martin Rosenbaum, Jon Savan, Ian Ferguson, Paul Sabella and Julian Harris
results.brief_description: A Room Full of Energy was produced to familiarize children with the concept of energy and to stimulate their interest in energy conservation. Through the magic of animation, the moon comes down from the sky to reveal the marvels of energy to a young boy and girl. The film describes the nature and role of every type of energy, from wood-burning to nuclear energy, illustrating where each comes from and how it is used. Music by Rick Elger.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Barry Milligan
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: Room for discussion: productivity
results.brief_description: One of a series of films designed for the general public on the subject of industrial productivity. A panel consisting of a leading British economist, a managing director of a large industrial organisation, a prominent trade unionist and a member of the British Productivity Council answer questions and discuss problems put to them by an invited audience representing the general public.

results.title: Room for discussion: group relations
results.brief_description: Examines the nature and function of discussion in both its personal aspects and also in its broader aspects. Intended to develop an understanding of the process of discussion and create an interest in participating in such activity. Explains that discussion brings information to the individual, leads to a broader and richer life and expedites cooperative achievement. Emphasises that discussion is the privilege and responsibility of all citizens living in a democracy.

results.title: Room at the top
results.creator_credit: Remus Films, John Woolf and Jack Clayton
results.brief_description: Based on John Braine’s best-seller and directed by Jack Clayton, the top-notch cast, steamy sex scenes and candid exploration of class-divided Britain had critics hailing it as one of the most vivid stories of modern times. Determined to make it to the top, returned serviceman, Joe Lampton (Laurence Harvey) pursues the daughter of the richest man in town (Heather Sears). At the same time, irresistibly drawn to an older, married woman (Simone Signoret), Lampton becomes tangled in a web of lies and deceit which can only end in tragedy. Nominated for six Oscars and honoured with Academy Awards for Best Actress and Best Screenplay, this film is truly a great British classic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Remus Films, John Woolf and Jack Clayton

results.title: Room and board
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Randy Cartwright
results.brief_description: Animated story about a man who spends his whole life trying to open a door, the only object in the empty room in which he exists.

results.title: Rooftopics
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Joe Scully and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Views of Sydney Harbour, city and inner suburbs from the roof-tops of various buildings. Shows scenes of everyday activities, roof gardens, play-grounds, swimming pools, street traffic, etc. viewed from above. Includes humorous animated sequence involving a man, his towel and a woman beside a swimming pool. No spoken commentary. Edited by Wayne Le Clos; photographed by George Alexander; music by Eric Gross and script by Antonio Colacino.
